citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection, acquisition and disposition records maintained by the licensee did not fully and correctly
disclose all the required information regarding animals purchased, acquired, owned, held, leased or otherwise in the
licensee’s possession. The following records of acquisition/disposition were incomplete:
1) There was no record of the date of disposal of a 1-year-old female sheep that died.
2) For a group of 8 goats that were acquired from one individual there was no date of acquisition, species of animal
acquired, number of animals in the shipment, or vehicle license number and state. The licensee only had the information
recorded on the driver’s license of the person from whom the goats were acquired.
3) For a bison bull calf acquired on 11/13/2025, there was no record of the vehicle license number and state or driver’s
license number and state of the person from whom the bison calf was acquired.
Accurate and well-maintained records of acquisition and disposition of animals is critical to ensure a thorough inspection,
to rapidly identify and trace animals in a potential disease outbreak, to make sure all animals are accounted for, and to
verify animals at the facility receive adequate veterinary care.
The license shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information listed in
2.75(b)(1)(i)-(vii) concerning animals (other than dogs and cats) purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or
otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which are transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise
disposed of by the licensee. The records shall include any offspring born or hatched of any animal while in his or her
possession or under his or her control, to the extent that any identification or counting of offspring can be carried out
without unduly disturbing nesting or rearing activities.
To be corrected by close of business on 11/28/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
At the time of the inspection, acquisition and disposition records maintained by the licensee did not fully and correctly 
disclose all the required information regarding animals purchased, acquired, owned, held, leased or otherwise in the 
licensee’s possession. The following records of acquisition/disposition were incomplete: 
 
1) There was no record of the date of disposal of a 1-year-old female sheep that died. 
2) For a group of 8 goats that were acquired from one individual there was no date of acquisition, species of animal 
acquired, number of animals in the shipment, or vehicle license number and state. The licensee only had the information 
recorded on the driver’s license of the person from whom the goats were acquired. 
3) For a bison bull calf acquired on 11/13/2025, there was no record of the vehicle license number and state or driver’s 
license number and state of the person from whom the bison calf was acquired. 
 
Accurate and well-maintained records of acquisition and disposition of animals is critical to ensure a thorough inspection, 
to rapidly identify and trace animals in a potential disease outbreak, to make sure all animals are accounted for, and to 
verify animals at the facility receive adequate veterinary care. 
 
The license shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information listed in 
2.75(b)(1)(i)-(vii) concerning animals (other than dogs and cats) purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or 
otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which are transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise 
disposed of by the licensee. The records shall include any offspring born or hatched of any animal while in his or her 
possession or under his or her control, to the extent that any identification or counting of offspring can be carried out 
without unduly disturbing nesting or rearing activities. 
 
 
To be corrected by close of business on 11/28/2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

End Section
